Package uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools

Interface Summary
ChunkProvider  
CompositionChangedListener  
DataSource  
FeatureReader  
Filter  
FilterChangedListener  
GeoData GeoData objects are used in a large number of places throught GeoTools.
The role of a GeoData object is to associate id values with data values.
Examples of use include matching feature ids to data values for thematic mapping, Storing tool tip texts for displaying with features and for providing data to be graphed or otherwise ploted.
HighlightChangedListener  
HighlightPositionChangedListener  
IDChangedListener  
IDReferenced In order to relate geographic features to each other and to associated data each can be given a specific ID No.
Layer A layer contains geographic feature of some kind that can be displayed in a map.
LayerChangedListener  
LockableSize  
Marker  
ScaleChangedListener  
SelectionChangedListener  
SelectionPositionChangedListener  
SelectionRegionChangedListener  
Shader An interface to be used by shaders.
ShaderChangedListener  
ThemeChangedListener  
Tool Tools will be used by Viewers to represent all forms of user interaction.
ViewerClickedListener  
ViewerClickListener

Class Summary
ArcInfoReader An extention of the DataInputStream that handels the Input of Geo Primatives This version extracts polygon maps from Arc/Info Generate files.
CartogramLayer  
CenterOnPointTool Provides the zoom funtionality for viewers.
ChunkLayer  
CircleLayer A layer for containing a feature set of GeoCircles Circle Layer now extends ShapeLayer which now does a lot of the common work for layers
CircleMarker  
ClassificationShader  
ClockFilter  
CompositionChangedEvent  
ContiguityList  
ContiguityMatrix  
CrossMarker  
CSVReader This class provides methods for reading data from CVS files and produces GeoData objects from their contents.
DBFFileReader A class to load geopoints from a DBF (xBase) file without using a shapefile.
DiscreteShader Unlike rampshaders, descrete shaders have a set number of catagories This class is the base from which percentile, quantile and look-up are extended.
DummyFilter  
DummyTool this class is for testing only I want to plot a circle as a tool
ExpressionGeoData  
FilterChangedEvent  
FirstPastPostShader  
GeoCircle This class is intended for storing circles such as those that make up cartograms
GeoDataUtils  
GeoFormLabel A simple label that can display items from a GeoData object.
GeoGraphics The GeoGraphics class is a wrapper for a standard awt.Graphics object that also conains all of the style, filtering and scaleing objects needed by a layer to paint itself.
GeoLabel A simple label that can display items from a GeoData object.
GeoLine This class is intended for storing georaphical line data such as roads, rivers etc.
GeoPoint A double presision point.
GeoPolygon This class is intended for storing georaphical polygons such as boundry data for wards, costlines etc.
GeoRectangle A double presision rectangle.
GeoShape The abstract base class for all GeoTools shape objects
GraphLayer  
GraphViewer  
HighlightChangedEvent  
HighlightManager Comunicates between GeoTools components so that multiple views can share and display the same highlight information.
By assigning the same HighlightManager to multiple GeoTools components, they will automaticaly produce a form of linked display, such that highlight selections in one view will show up instanly in all the others.
HighlightPositionChangedEvent An event used to notify listeners that the user has selected a new position to highlight.
HSVShader  
IDChangedEvent  
IDComparator An implementation of the collection Comparator interface that allows for the comparing of objects that implement the IDReferenced interface.
IDFilter  
ImageMarker ImageMarker creates a marker icon out of images passed in as parameters.
Key The abstract base class used by all keys.
A key is a small panel which represents the information needed to interprit the colours provided by a shader.
Each shader type should provide an implementation of this class so that it can be displayed.
KeyBox  
KeyHolder  
LabelFilter  
LatLongGrid  
LayerChangedEvent  
LineKey The abstract base class used by all keys.
A key is a small panel which represents the information needed to interprit the colours provided by a shader.
Each shader type should provide an implementation of this class so that it can be displayed.
LineKeyBox  
LineLayer  
LODFilter A class to handle Level Of Detail filtering in themes.
LogicalAddFilter  
LogicalOrFilter  
LogicFilter  
MapExtentLayer  
MarkerLayer  
MetaShader This is an experimental wrapper used to hold shaders.
By using this it should be possible to switch between different shading stratergies in a simple manner.
MixedLayer  
MonoKey  
MonoShader By far the most straight forward of the shaders, it will shade the whole of a map one color.
MouseStatus Mouse Status is a new class designed to take some of load (and code bloat) out of the main Viewer class.
Although MouseStatus objects should only be setup and configured by Viewer objects MouseStatus objects will be usefull for objects that are to act as tools in conjunction with a Viewer as the MouseStatus should carry all of the information any tool should need to know about what and where a user has been interacting with the mouse on the viewer.
The MouseStatus class tracks mouse movements (particularly drags) in three co-ordinate systems.
MultiLayer an experimental class to hold multiple layers as if a single layer.
MultiPanTool  
MultiPointHSVShader  
MultiTheme an experimental class to hold multiple layers in a single theme.
MultiZoomTool  
NavigateTool  
NotFilter  
NullShape A null shape can be used as an IDReferenced object without the need for any feature information.
A null shape might be used as a placeholder for a missing or non existent feature, but its main use is for quickly seting up an IDReferenced object that others can be compared against.
OddEvenDemoFilter This class is only to demonstrate how a filter could be writen.
OneClickZoomInTool Provides the zoom funtionality for viewers.
OneClickZoomOutTool OneClickZoomInTool is a simple alternative to the zoom tool that zooms out on a point.
PanTool A Pan tool for use with Viewers.
PointKey The abstract base class used by all keys.
A key is a small panel which represents the information needed to interprit the colours provided by a shader.
Each shader type should provide an implementation of this class so that it can be displayed.
PointKeyBox  
PointLayer  
PolygonLayer A layer for storing geographic features that can be represented by polygons.

ShadeStyle A shade style is passed to layers when they require re-painting.

ShapefileWriter A class to simplify the process of writing an ESRI(r) Shapefile.
ShapeLayer Shape layer is holds all of the common code used by layers that contain GeoShape features Much of the code in this class used to be duplicated multiple times by a number of classes
SimpleFilter  
SimpleGeoData A concrete implementation of the GeoData interface, it is suitable for most uses and may be extended for more specialist GeoData implementations.
SimpleLayer  
SimpleShader An abstract but almost full implementation of the Shader interface.
